posts.title: Weekend Trip to Cornwall: The Eden Project and Newquay
posts.title_plain: Weekend Trip to Cornwall: The Eden Project and Newquay
posts.content:
Tickets only £85!

Celebrate the end of term and join us on our weekend trip to Cornwall!

Day 1: The Eden Project –  The Eden Project is a truly unique experience, in the heart of Cornwall. A dramatic global garden filled with jungles and waterfalls.

Day 2: Full day to spend in Newquay as you wish – go surfing, enjoy the beach, experience the beautiful Cornish countryside or take an excursion.

Day 3 – Half day in Newquay to spend as you wish, then coach travel back to Portsmouth.

Tickets include coach travel, tickets to the Eden Project, two nights accommodation in Newquay, including breakfast.

posts.title: Coach Trip to Longleat Safari Park
posts.title_plain: Coach Trip to Longleat Safari Park
posts.content:
Tickets only £35!

Get up close and personal with lions, elephants and giraffes and many more, on this drive-through safari and meet the monkeys as you walk through Monkey Temple.

Ticket price includes coach travel, entry to the safari park and entry to the Elizabethan Longleat House.

posts.title: Coach Trip to Oxford
posts.content: Tickets only £15! For over 800 years, Oxford has been home to royalty and scholars, and nowadays it is a bustling cosmopolitan city, full of history and culture. Ticket includes coach travel only. You are free to spend the day in Oxford as you wish.

posts.title: Postgraduate and Part-time Undergraduate Study Open Evening
posts.title_plain: Postgraduate and Part-time Undergraduate Study Open Evening
posts.content:
On Thursday 16 February 2017, between 5.30pm and 7.30pm, Portsmouth Business School is holding an open evening for those interested in postgraduate or part-time undergraduate study.

Over drinks and canapés, you will have the opportunity to find out more about our courses, and meet lecturers, current students, and people such as yourself, who are considering the benefits of studying at one of the South’s best business schools.

For more information, and to register, please visit www.showyoumeanbusiness.com

posts.title: Wellbeing Festival
posts.content:
The University and the Students’ Union are holding a Wellbeing Festival on Wednesday 15 February. The theme will be about celebrating the five ways to wellbeing:

  • connect
  • be active
  • take notice
  • keep learning
  • give

More information to follow in the new year.

posts.title: University of Law Assessment Day Exercise
posts.title_plain: University of Law Assessment Day Exercise
posts.content:
This is a commercial awareness workshop based on the fictitious scenario of Vladimir Chenko and Fairfield United Football Club.

The workshop is designed for both law and non-law students and is the perfect preparation for a typical assessment day exercise.

Each group within the session will form their own ‘law firm’, and during the session will be asked to take part in a Q&A session with Mr Chenko and produce a presentation about the potential takeover of the FC by Mr Chenko.

It will encourage commercial awareness, presentation skills, and start to present the skills required to becoming a lawyer.

Book your place on MyPurpleDoor here

posts.title: Personal Brand with PwC
posts.content:
This employability session looks at your personal brand and how you can best represent yourself, with particular focus on the link between your personal brand and employability and the factors that will help you sell yourself and stand out to a potential employer.

This session is being presented by PwC.

posts.title: Opportunity Meets Talent Convention
posts.content:
Are you a student looking to get your foot on the career ladder?

This event is your chance to meet the region’s leading businesses, recruiters and educators to grab opportunities for future employment.

You will also have the chance to share CVs, hear about live job opportunities from employers, attend a number of “Insight Into” sessions to learn more about working within specific sectors and much more.

Student entry to this event is Free! See details at the Eventbrite page here

posts.title: RN Engineering Leadership Programme – Theoretical Event
posts.title_plain: RN Engineering Leadership Programme – Theoretical Event
posts.content:
Suitable for students from an engineering and physics background – all years.

Who said that starting an engineering career can’t be the beginning of a lifelong adventure? Or that you have to choose between a responsible 9-5 job and seeing the world?

The Royal Navy is looking for engineering students of your calibre to be the future of the Naval Service. Join Engineer Officers and recent graduates at a Theoretical Leadership Event on 31 January 2017.

You will have the chance to gain an insight into the leadership skills required for a truly unique engineering career. The Royal Navy has started an exclusive paid internship programme for engineering students like you. The 12 successful applicants will spend six weeks working with Engineering Officers across the different engineering disciplines and branches of the Royal Navy, seeing first-hand what life as an officer is like, and how diverse, challenging and rewarding Naval engineering is.

At the social, you can also find out more about life in the Royal Navy, the bursaries of up to £4,000 per year that are available while you’re still studying, the competitive starting salaries – and the £27,000 joining bonus Engineer Officers receive.

Book your place at MyPurpleDoor here.
posts.excerpt: Suitable for students from an engineering and physics background – all years. Who said that starting an engineering career can’t be the beginning of a lifelong adventure? Or that you have to choose…

posts.title: Teaching Fair 2017
posts.content:
If you are on the first couple of steps towards getting into teaching, this fair is a fantastic opportunity for you to meet prospective employers and organisations.

You will be able to discuss with teachers, school staff, learning providers and specialist recruiters about what they are looking for in new teaching staff.

Come along and meet local employers looking to recruit into their NQT/ITT opportunities.

30+ employers from across the region will be at the Third Space ready to meet and discuss their opportunities with you.

Find out more information here.

Book your place at this event via MyPurpleDoor here.

posts.content:

posts.title: Speaking with Confidence and Giving Presentations
posts.title_plain: Speaking with Confidence and Giving Presentations
posts.content:
This Academic Skills Unit workshop will help you to look and feel more confident when speaking in front of others.

It deals with the effects of nerves and will help you to project yourself well and engage your audience. It will also help polish existing skills. It will assist your performance in assessed presentations or practice, and contribute to your future graduate career and interview skills.

You can attend individually or as a group (please note that numbers are limited). If you cannot attend any of the timetabled workshops, you are invited to form a group of three or more for a bespoke workshop. For further information, please contact: heather.lee@port.ac.uk

Please book for the workshops through Eventbrite.

For enquiries or to book a one-to-one tutorial: email academicskills@port.ac.uk; telephone 023 9284 3462
posts.excerpt: This Academic Skills Unit workshop will help you to look and feel more confident when speaking in front of others. It deals with the effects of nerves and will help you to project…

posts.title: Social Startup programme (Workshop 5)
posts.content:
Are you interested in tackling social problems, improving communities, helping to improve people’s lives or the environment? If so, why not join our Social Startup programme.

The Social Startup programme is a series of workshops designed to take an idea, develop it and launch a social enterprise. Social Startup aims to inspire you and support you through a range of practical tools, resources, mentoring and networking activities.

The Social Startup programme workshops are aimed at students and graduates* who have a social idea that they would like to develop.

Using a range of tools we will help you explore your idea further and take you through the stages of developing it into a sustainable project/startup.

You can develop an idea by yourself or as a team. By developing your social idea you will be on the journey to launching your own social startup.

The workshops will provide you with practical tools and specific Social Startup resources designed to help you develop your idea and support is on hand throughout and after the programme.

Dates for the workshops:

Workshop 1: Wednesday 2 November 2016 1pm-5pm
Workshop 2: Wednesday 9 November 2016 1pm-5pm
One week break Wednesday 16 November (Opportunity to attend the one day inter-university Dynamo Challenge where this year the theme is social enterprise)
Workshop 3: Wednesday 23 November 2016 1pm-5pm
Workshop 4: Wednesday 30 November 2016 1pm-5pm
Workshop 5: Wednesday 7 December 2016 1pm-5pm

You will need to be free to attend all five workshops.
posts.excerpt: Are you interested in tackling social problems, improving communities, helping to improve people’s lives or the environment? If so, why not join our Social Startup programme. The Social Startup programme is a series of…

posts.title: School of Earth and Environmental Sciences Fair
posts.title_plain: School of Earth and Environmental Sciences Fair
posts.content:
Come along to this year’s School of Earth and Environmental Sciences Fair to meet a variety of great employers in this sector.

Some of the companies attending include Frontier, Leap Environmental Ltd, Leca UK, Arcadis, Geotechnical Engineering Limited, IEMA and more to be announced!

Attending the event is a great opportunity to:

  • discover information not available on company websites in order to boost your application/CV
  • share your CV with companies that interest you
  • find out about available graduate jobs and placement opportunities
  • speak to company representatives about their experiences in the job market

We look forward to meeting you on 30 November!

Click here to book your place on MyPurpleDoor.

posts.title: Coach Trip to Birmingham Christmas Market
posts.title_plain: Coach Trip to Birmingham Christmas Market
posts.content:
Coach Trip to Birmingham Christmas Market

Tickets only £15!

With more than 180 stalls, Birmingham’s traditional attraction is the largest outdoor Christmas market in the UK, and the biggest outside Germany and Austria.

Also included in the market is a Big Wheel and an Ice Rink.

The PERFECT way to get in the Christmas spirit, get your tickets NOW!

www.port.ac.uk/pay/io

posts.title: Mock Assessment Centre with IBM
posts.content:
Not sure what to expect at an assessment centre?

Come along to this session to understand what a real life assessment centre will be like at one of the UK’s top graduate employers.

The dedicated team of IBMers will be on hand to give you an insight into the process and what assessors expect. You’ll get to take part in group activities just like during the real thing.

Participating in this session will enable you to:

  • Increase your familiarity with the range of exercises used by employers in assessment centres
  • Identify your own strengths and weaknesses and use feedback to improve your performance to give you the advantage over others

Click here to add the event to your 

Book your place on MyPurpleDoor here
